intro: Batrachium paucistamineum var. eradicatum, commonly known as the rare swamp bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is typically found in wetland habitats. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor aquatic environments. Its leaves are often submerged, while its flowers emerge above the water surface. This variety is considered endangered due to habitat loss and degradation.
